alert.note: Alert for Wheeler (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 09 at 10:06AM PDT until May 11 at 4:43AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... John Day River at Service Creek affecting Wheeler County. For the John Day River...including Service Creek...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pdt. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...John Day River at Service Creek. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM PDT Tuesday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.2 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday night. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 03/14/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri John Day River Service Creek 11.5 11.9 Tue 9 am PDT 11.9 11.0 10.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
